parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the manual transmission can cause the vehicle to lose power, leading to accidents or stranding the driver. It can also result in costly repairs and downtime.
symptoms: The transmission fails to engage or disengage gears
the vehicle accelerates slowly or hesitates
the transmission slips or hesitates when shifting
the vehicle de-accelerates or stalls
the transmission makes unusual noises or vibrations.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the transmission can cause the vehicle to jump out of gear, leading to loss of control and potential accidents. It can also result in costly repairs and leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The transmission jumps out of gear
the transmission slips or hesitates
difficulty shifting gears
unusual noises or vibrations from the transmission.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Lack of Proper Maintenance and Inspection
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure to properly inspect and maintain the vehicle can lead to premature wear and failure of critical components, resulting in costly repairs and potential safety hazards.
symptoms: Failure to check and maintain transmission fluid levels
failure to inspect and replace worn-out components
failure to diagnose and repair underlying issues.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the exhaust system can lead to decreased performance, reduced fuel efficiency, and potential safety hazards due to carbon monoxide poisoning.
symptoms: Rust or corrosion on the exhaust system
vibrations or noises from the exhaust system
decreased performance or fuel efficiency.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Disputes over warranty coverage and maintenance responsibilities can lead to frustration and financial burden for vehicle owners.
symptoms: Denial of warranty claims
disputes over maintenance responsibilities
conflicting opinions on repair needs and costs.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The intermittent failure of the electrical system can cause various safety-critical systems to malfunction, leading to accidents or leaving the driver stranded. This includes issues with the speedometer, tachometer, air conditioner, check engine light, ABS, and turn signals.
symptoms: Speedometer and tachometer freezing or malfunctioning
air conditioner failure
check engine light
ABS light
or trunk light coming on
turn signals malfunctioning
hazards lights coming on instead of turn signals
electrical components overheating or melting.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure to properly diagnose and repair electrical system malfunctions can lead to continued safety risks and financial burdens for vehicle owners.
symptoms: Repeated repairs and replacements of electrical components without resolving the underlying issue
misdiagnosis of the problem
and failure to identify the root cause of the malfunction.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Water entering the vehicle compartment through poorly designed rubber seals along the convertible top can cause damage to electrical components, rust, and mold growth, leading to safety hazards and costly repairs.
symptoms: Water leaks into the vehicle compartment
water spots or stains on interior surfaces
musty odors
rust or corrosion on metal components.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Convertible Top Design Obstructs Rear View
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The excessive cloth material on the convertible top can obstruct the rear view, increasing the risk of accidents or near-misses.
symptoms: Reduced visibility through the rearview mirror
difficulty seeing other vehicles or pedestrians behind the vehicle
increased risk of accidents or near-misses.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The malfunction of the cruise control system can cause sudden acceleration, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, or near-miss incidents.
symptoms: The vehicle accelerates suddenly
the cruise control speed increases unexpectedly
pressing the "set" button causes the vehicle to accelerate
pressing the "res" button does not respond
the cruise control system does not function properly.
